Beautiful sightings of butterflies ü¶ã, turtles üê¢, lots of fish üê†, and sting ray too!!! There is a variety of things to see here. I believe it‚Äôs free access, but they do accept donations. topComments.author: Bill
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Eu andei no cal√ßad√£o Gumbo Limbo que fica entre a Ocean Blvd. Estacionamento que fica a sul e anexo ao Campo de Golfe e ao Centro Natural Gumbo Limbo. O cal√ßad√£o √© quase meia milha com um par de trilhas laterais. Voc√™ pode entrar no Nature Center gratuitamente, mas eles pedem doa√ß√µes. Sugest√£o de doa√ß√£o de $ 5,00 por pessoa. Isso √© um √≥timo neg√≥cio. Tenho certeza de que √© apenas uma pequena parte do que mant√©m este lugar funcionando. H√° tamb√©m uma loja de presentes fora da sala principal que tem presentes muito agrad√°veis. Tudo √© um pouco caro, mas voc√™ est√° ajudando a apoiar o Gumbo Limbo, ent√£o tudo bem. Minha esposa comprou uma linda bolsa de lona com uma tartaruga.  Agora que o Nature Center est√° reaberto ao p√∫blico fui l√° com minha esposa e minha m√£e. Eu realmente n√£o sabia o que esperar dentro do Nature Center. Uma vez l√° dentro, h√° algumas exposi√ß√µes para ver. A mulher na recep√ß√£o nos perguntou se precis√°vamos de um mapa e sugeriu que f√¥ssemos ver a Tartaruga falar l√° embaixo. Acabamos de chegar um pouco antes desta conversa come√ßar. Ent√£o, fomos para a alavanca inferior. H√° uma longa rampa que muda de volta para cadeira de rodas ou caminhantes para usar facilmente. Havia cerca de 20 pessoas l√° ouvindo a palestra. Era sobre as diferentes tartarugas nos tanques de l√°. Ela explicou um pouco sobre cada tartaruga e por que ela estava l√°.  Gumbo Limbo √© composto de quatro partes diferentes. Cal√ßad√£o, resgate de tartarugas, peixes, jardim de borboletas. O borbolet√°rio fica no extremo norte e tem um caminho chamado Ashley Trail que d√° a volta e desce at√© o intercoastal onde h√° uma pequena praia e um banco. √â um bom lugar para relaxar e olhar para a √°gua. N√£o √© permitido entrar na √°gua. Os aqu√°rios marinhos ao ar livre s√£o incr√≠veis. Dois grandes tanques com cerca de um metro de profundidade com janelas para que voc√™ possa ver os peixes nadando de cima ou atrav√©s das janelas, al√©m de outros dois tanques com mais de tr√™s metros de profundidade que voc√™ v√™ atrav√©s de grandes janelas. Passamos muito tempo observando os peixes, raias, tartarugas, enguias se movendo pelos tanques. Os sinais identificam cada uma das diferentes esp√©cies.  O Gumbo Limbo √© administrado por funcion√°rios pagos e volunt√°rios. Conversando com um volunt√°rio, ela disse que eles s√£o compostos de volunt√°rios durante todo o ano e alguns p√°ssaros da neve. Todos s√£o simp√°ticos e prestativos. Voltaremos tanto para passear no cal√ßad√£o quanto para visitar o Nature Center.  (Original) I walked on the Gumbo Limbo boardwalk that‚Äôs between Ocean Blvd. Parking which is to the south and attached to the Golf Course and the Gumbo Limbo Nature Center. The boardwalk is almost half a mile with a couple of side trails. You can go into the Nature Center for free but they ask for donations. Suggested $5.00 donation per person.  That‚Äôs a great deal. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs only a small part of what keeps this place running. There is also a gift shop off the main room that has very nice gifts. Everything is a bit expensive but you are helping to support Gumbo Limbo so it‚Äôs fine. My wife got a nice canvas shoulder bag with a turtle on it.  Now that the Nature Center is reopened to the public I went there with my wife and my mother. I didn‚Äôt really know what to expect inside the Nature Center. Once inside there are a few exhibits to look at. The woman at the desk asked us if we needed a map and suggested that we go to see the Turtle talk downstairs. We just happened to arrive just before this talk was starting So we headed off down to the lower lever. There is a long ramp that switches back for wheelchair or walkers to easily use. There were about 20 people there listening to the talk. It was about the different turtles in the tanks there. She explained a little about each turtle and why it was there.  Gumbo Limbo is made up of four different parts. Boardwalk, Turtle rescue, Fish, Butterfly garden. The butterfly garden is on the north end and it has a path called Ashley Trail that heads around and down to the intercoastal where there is a small beach and bench. It‚Äôs a good place to relax and look at the water. Entering the water is not allowed. The Outdoor Marine Aquariums are amazing. Two large tanks about three feet deep with windows so you can view the fish swimming from above or through the windows plus another two tanks over ten feet deep that you view through large windows. We spend a long time watching the fish, rays, turtles, eels moving around the tanks. Signs identify each of the different species.  Gumbo Limbo is run by both paid employees and volunteers. Talking to one volunteer she said that they are made up of year round and some snow bird volunteers. Everyone is friendly and helpful. We will be back to both walk the boardwalk and to visit the Nature Center.
